title: Reflecting on 2025: Researching, Connecting, and Exploring
content: This blog has slowly transformed into a place where I just publish annual year in review posts. I may still consider other types of posts in the future, but for the time being, I will be sure to at the very least maintain this annual tradition. This is the 13th one of these year end […]
creator: tjowens

title: Reflecting on 2024: Connecting, Learning, and Growing
content: As a year comes to a close I try to round up and reflect a bit on this trip around the sun. This is the year 11th one of these year end reflective posts that I’ve written. If you are curious, you can see my reflections at the end of 2023,  2022,  2021,  2020, 2019,  […]

title: Awe, Tree Rings, and Stars: Top Five Reads of 2023
content: It was a pretty good reading year for me. I met the target of 50 books that I set for my Goodreads reading challenge. As part of gearing up for this new year, I went back and pulled the five books that I am sure I’m going to keep thinking about. In no particular order, […]

title: The Theory and Craft of Digital Preservation en Español
content: The open access version of the Spanish translation of my book The Theory and Craft of Digital Preservation is now available online. La teoría y el oficio de la preservación digital was produced by a team of library and information science experts led by Isabel Galina Russell. It was published earlier this year in print […]
creator: tjowens

title: Advance Praise for After Disruption
content: My next book is a little closer to being fully finished. After working through some thoughtful feedback from peer reviewers I am now reviewing a round of copy edits. In fun news, the book now has a page on the University of Michigan Press website. It also has BISAC subjects, a DOI, and three different […]
creator: tjowens

title: New Paper: Slide Decks as Government Publications
content: I’m excited to share that I have a new paper out, Slide Decks as Government Publications: Exploring Two Decades of PowerPoint Files Archived from U.S. Government Websites, in the journal Archival Science. This paper is a collaboration between myself and Jonah Estess. If you don’t have access to the final version, you can see a […]
creator: tjowens

title: Open Review of the Second Half of “After Disruption: A Future for Cultural Memory”
content: I’m excited to be able to share the second half of my next book, After Disruption: A Future for Cultural Memory with you for input and comments.
